messages: 4db1d4a794c6a0e217302385866a5322 (20:33): anyone with some free time?

4db1d4a794c6a0e217302385866a5322 (20:39): tbsaunde, : I'm not sure if that's something I should fix, or on the contrary, it's the indication that line 269 should be removed

4db1d4a794c6a0e217302385866a5322 (20:40): tbsaunde, : or alternatively you can tell me where does this "application" take place

4db1d4a794c6a0e217302385866a5322 (20:41): tbsaunde, : I think I just need a english-to-english translation
4db1d4a794c6a0e217302385866a5322 (20:43): tbsaunde: what does "pick up" in the bug title means?
94d50e2efa8ecc99acd742d7cdd18f4a (20:44): 4db1d4a794c6a0e217302385866a5322: start at ApplyARIAState() on nsAccessible
94d50e2efa8ecc99acd742d7cdd18f4a (20:44): and move to nsStateMapEntry::MapToStates()
94d50e2efa8ecc99acd742d7cdd18f4a (20:45): which is a horrible confusing mess btw
94d50e2efa8ecc99acd742d7cdd18f4a (20:46): 4db1d4a794c6a0e217302385866a5322: the idea roughly is that the right states will get appied for that type of thing if eRIAFoo is there
94d50e2efa8ecc99acd742d7cdd18f4a (20:46): so since eARIASelectable is there then the accessible might have states::SELECTED set and probably should have states::SELECTABLE set.
94d50e2efa8ecc99acd742d7cdd18f4a (20:47): but I'm pretty sure davidb  knows this code better
4db1d4a794c6a0e217302385866a5322 (20:50): yes, but there is no gk_atom aria-selectable
4db1d4a794c6a0e217302385866a5322 (20:50): it's pretty easy to add one, but I don't think that's the point

906cca2a5ed603c0f4e8b08b56a80768 (20:50): 4db1d4a794c6a0e217302385866a5322: I think he means that we shouldn't be exposing selectable or checkable states on accessible objects that represent elements with role='listitem'
906cca2a5ed603c0f4e8b08b56a80768 (20:50): 4db1d4a794c6a0e217302385866a5322: look for aria-selected
906cca2a5ed603c0f4e8b08b56a80768 (20:51): or grep -ri "aria-select" in our tests directory
4db1d4a794c6a0e217302385866a5322 (20:51): we're exposing it by defining eARIASelectable and eARIACheckedMixed, right?
906cca2a5ed603c0f4e8b08b56a80768 (20:51): those rules mean that we care.
906cca2a5ed603c0f4e8b08b56a80768 (20:52): if you can run our test suite, run it. then remove the rule, run it, see what breaks, see if it should or shouldn't break.
906cca2a5ed603c0f4e8b08b56a80768 (20:52): modify accordingly :)
4db1d4a794c6a0e217302385866a5322 (20:52): so is it just about removig these two lines?
906cca2a5ed603c0f4e8b08b56a80768 (20:52): probably
906cca2a5ed603c0f4e8b08b56a80768 (20:52): preps for a 3pm meeting
94d50e2efa8ecc99acd742d7cdd18f4a (20:52): thinks so
94d50e2efa8ecc99acd742d7cdd18f4a (20:53): davidb: probably better to just grep -r since you know its not capitolized,  and -i makes grep a lot slower
4db1d4a794c6a0e217302385866a5322 (20:53): ok, so it's about removing two lines, and finding if everything works, right?

906cca2a5ed603c0f4e8b08b56a80768 (20:53): tbsaunde: could save a couple msecs yeah

94d50e2efa8ecc99acd742d7cdd18f4a (20:55): there not fast enough though

4db1d4a794c6a0e217302385866a5322 (20:56): though I'll try to do something else yet :)
4db1d4a794c6a0e217302385866a5322 (20:56): where are the tests?
94d50e2efa8ecc99acd742d7cdd18f4a (20:57): accessible/test/
94d50e2efa8ecc99acd742d7cdd18f4a (20:57): or maybe accessible/tests/
4db1d4a794c6a0e217302385866a5322 (21:00): ok, but I don't see python files there
4db1d4a794c6a0e217302385866a5322 (21:00): in bug it's mentioned to run some python script
4db1d4a794c6a0e217302385866a5322 (21:00): in accessible/tests/ I spot only makefiles
94d50e2efa8ecc99acd742d7cdd18f4a (21:01): there's a bunch of html and js too
4db1d4a794c6a0e217302385866a5322 (21:01): ok, and how to fire tests?
94d50e2efa8ecc99acd742d7cdd18f4a (21:01): the python script is just a test harness that runs the html / js in firefox
94d50e2efa8ecc99acd742d7cdd18f4a (21:01): easiest way is make -C objdir mchitest-a11y
4db1d4a794c6a0e217302385866a5322 (21:01): where from, obj-dir or moz-central?
94d50e2efa8ecc99acd742d7cdd18f4a (21:01): * mochitest-a11y
94d50e2efa8ecc99acd742d7cdd18f4a (21:02): -C for make is the dir to run in
4db1d4a794c6a0e217302385866a5322 (21:02): should I be woried with warnings or not?

94d50e2efa8ecc99acd742d7cdd18f4a (21:04): well, it would be nice if you fixed them, but you didn't introduce that, so not really
4db1d4a794c6a0e217302385866a5322 (21:06): ok, got 1 failed test, and some TODOs.
4db1d4a794c6a0e217302385866a5322 (21:07): no, something failed
4db1d4a794c6a0e217302385866a5322 (21:13): ok, something weird just happened, I will report to you that in an hour, ok?
94d50e2efa8ecc99acd742d7cdd18f4a (21:14): sure
94d50e2efa8ecc99acd742d7cdd18f4a (21:17): davidb: do we have reason to believe we'll want nsRoleMapEntry::roleRule to have more values than use map role and  use native role?
75df260141e66615dd50d0fa9e80d615 (21:25): Hi all. Firefox 10 is going to be a long-term support release, right?
81fa1e07c4ea96f215901d989f8bf37b (21:25): that is the plan, yes

75df260141e66615dd50d0fa9e80d615 (21:27): Is the procedure for getting things into the beta documented somewhere? I'd like to have the fix for bug 693343 make it into Firefox 10--especially if 10 is going to be around for a while, it really should be included
75df260141e66615dd50d0fa9e80d615 (21:28): though how to backport it would kinda depend on whether 451161/705983 get included
81fa1e07c4ea96f215901d989f8bf37b (21:28): unfortunately it is not
81fa1e07c4ea96f215901d989f8bf37b (21:29): I would suggest nominating it for beta saying that you think it's important for the ESR
81fa1e07c4ea96f215901d989f8bf37b (21:29): that's more or less the only process here
75df260141e66615dd50d0fa9e80d615 (21:29): 81fa1e07c4ea96f215901d989f8bf37b: Okay; thanks. How do I "nominate it for beta?"
81fa1e07c4ea96f215901d989f8bf37b (21:30): set approval-beta? on the patch
81fa1e07c4ea96f215901d989f8bf37b (21:31): or approval-mozilla-beta
81fa1e07c4ea96f215901d989f8bf37b (21:31): or something like that
94d50e2efa8ecc99acd742d7cdd18f4a (21:36): 75df260141e66615dd50d0fa9e80d615:  looks lke they'll be in beta, they were approved last night, and a backported patch was posted
75df260141e66615dd50d0fa9e80d615 (21:36): tbsaunde: heh, I would've realized that if I'd checked my email before blabbering away :)
75df260141e66615dd50d0fa9e80d615 (21:36): A backport should be done before requesting approval, I assume?
94d50e2efa8ecc99acd742d7cdd18f4a (21:37): 75df260141e66615dd50d0fa9e80d615: no need
94d50e2efa8ecc99acd742d7cdd18f4a (21:38): back port is probably just apply the patch I doubt that code has changed
81fa1e07c4ea96f215901d989f8bf37b (21:45): ideally
81fa1e07c4ea96f215901d989f8bf37b (21:45): usually people nominate, get approval, and then realize it doesn't apply ;-)
75df260141e66615dd50d0fa9e80d615 (21:46): Do you then need to ask for approval again after backporting?
75df260141e66615dd50d0fa9e80d615 (21:47): I know the patch wouldn't apply against 8 or perhaps 9 because of PRBool -> bool changes and the like, but I don't think that applies to 10
94d50e2efa8ecc99acd742d7cdd18f4a (21:47): I think that would depend how extensive the change is
94d50e2efa8ecc99acd742d7cdd18f4a (21:49): if I have to deal with PRBool stuff I'll just fix that before I push, I can't think of a reason that should effect
94d50e2efa8ecc99acd742d7cdd18f4a (21:49): approval
